intro: Hesperis cuspidata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scabious, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with cruciform flowers. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in a loose, branching inflorescence. Its leaves are narrow and often have a slight serration along the edges. Hesperis cuspidata is often found in dry, sunny habitats such as rocky soils and grasslands.
